title: and it's not Charles, Kate Middleton or Meghan Markle
text:

The Queen has a supportive, dedicated and loyal family her who are always eager to please and help her whenever they can.

Her four children and eight grandchildren take on their fair share of royal duties, and as she begins to take things a bit slower at 93 she has handed some of her patronages down.

And it's not just her direct relatives who are around her, and she also relies heavily on their partners, especially the senior ones including the Duchess of Cambridge and Meghan Markle .

But there is one member of the family who insiders say the Queen really enjoys spending time with, and it's not who you might expect.

(Image: Getty Images)

A royal source told the Sun that the Monarch will often ask Sophie Wessex to join her in the car on their journey to church if they are both in Sandringham or Balmoral.

The Countess of Wessex is married to Prince Edward, the Queen's youngest son, and the couple have two children Lady Louise Windsor and James Viscount Severn.

The insider said: "The Queen likes to be completely calm before church and she finds Sophie’s presence soothing."

(Image: UK Press via Getty Images)

(Image: Getty Images)

When Sophie married Edward she decided against becoming a working royal, insisting on continuing her work in public relations.

The insider added: "She is trusted and relied on by the Queen in a way I couldn't say applied to the Duchess of Cambridge or the Duchess of Cornwall.

"She is like another daughter to Her Majesty, they are that close."

Edward is the only one of the Queen's children who is still married to their first partner, which the source says the Queen "knows that is in no small way down to Sophie’s dedication - she is aware, as his Edward’s mother, what a tricky creature he can be".

(Image: Tim Graham Photo Library via Get)

And the Queen isn't the only member of the Royal Family who looks to Sophie for help, and she has reportedly been an "unofficial mentor and ally" to Meghan Markle .

Royal Biographer Katie Nicholl revealed in Grazia that the Queen "earmarked" Sophie as a royal mentor for Meghan.

The two -in-laws spent time together at Royal Ascot last year and are believed to get along well.

(Image: UK Press)

It's perhaps not surprising given the similarities, as they both had successful careers before marrying into The Firm.

But it's also thought to be the Wessex's "quiet lifestyle" which appeals to Meghan.

A source told Grazia: "The Queen likes the idea of Sophie being an unofficial mentor to Meghan.

"Sophie is often at Windsor taking the kids riding on the Queen's horses and playing at the castle. It’'s a quiet lifestyle, very much the kind Harry and Meghan want for their little one."
description: The Queen's relatives are some of the most famous faces in the world, including Kate Middleton, Meghan Markle and Princes Charles, William and Harry - but it's one of the more junior members she often looks to
authors: Tim Graham Photo Library Via Get
